wikipedia_page.main: Lady Juliet Margaret Townsend, DCVO (née Smith; 9 September 1941 – 29 November 2014) was a British writer who served as Lord Lieutenant of Northamptonshire from 1998 to 2014, the first woman to hold this position.

response: In 1935, he married The Hon Sheila Berry (1913–1992), second daughter of the 1st Viscount Camrose. The couple had a son, Frederick William Robin Smith, 3rd Earl of Birkenhead, in 1936 and a daughter, Lady Juliet Margaret Smith (later Lady Juliet Townsend), in 1941. Lady Juliet served as Lady in Waiting to Princess Margaret from 1965 to 2002; her daughter Eleanor Townsend is a god-child of the Princess.Genealogy site , users.uniserve.com; accessed 3 July 2014. Lady Juliet was made a Dame Commander of the Royal Victorian Order (DCVO) in the 2014 Birthday Honours having previously received the LVO in 1981 and was Lord Lieutenant of Northamptonshire from 1998 to 2014. She died on 29 November 2014.The Daily Telegraph, Obituary, 4 December 2014

He was succeeded by his only son, the second Earl. He was also a Conservative politician and held minor office under Neville Chamberlain and Winston Churchill. However, Lord Birkenhead is best remembered as a biographer. He was succeeded by his only son, the third Earl. Like his father he was a biographer. He never married and the titles became extinct on his early death in 1985. The second Earl's daughter, Lady Juliet Townsend, was Lord Lieutenant of Northamptonshire.
* Lady Juliet Townsend (1941–2014), British writer and Lord Lieutenant of Northamptonshire

link_mentions.page: List of Somerville College, Oxford, people
response: *Lady Juliet Townsend, first female Lord Lieutenant of Northamptonshire
*Lady Juliet Townsend DCVO (1941–2014), writer, first female Lord Lieutenant of Northamptonshire

Smith was succeeded in his titles, and at Charlton, by his son, and subsequently his grandson. Lady Juliet Townsend, Birkenhead’s granddaughter, was brought up at the house. The Cottage remains a private residence and was restored in the early 21st century.
